author: hyperstruct
content:
Funny, because I had this jingle running through my head all the time while writing MozLab’s REPL, about how nice it would be to embed some incarnation of Lisp in Mozilla, one that could compile to C, and use it to write future components of the platform, gradually morphing Firefox into a Lisp Machine for the Internet Age.

Of course, now that Javascript will get a JIT compiler, and there is even a hint of Erlang-style concurrency (!), all that might be left to do would be a parser for S-exp syntax and a macro compiler…

Ok. I clearly still have that jingle.
